channel.title: Stories from “Le Mercure Galant” on
channel.description: Recent content in Stories from “Le Mercure Galant” on

item.description: Le Mercure Galant [Gallant Mercury], a literary periodical and gazette founded in 1672 by Jean Donneau de Visé (1638-1710), is one of the most important French cultural artifacts of the turn of the eighteenth century. Not only did its monthly issues keep the literate population informed about the latest news, gossip, fashion, art, etiquette, music, literature, and scientific discoveries, it also gave its readers the opportunity to weigh in as contributors—submitting sheet music, poems, riddles, short stories, and other newsworthy novelties, along with letters that outlined their perspectives on topics ranging from aesthetics and culture to philosophy and physics.

item.title: Our Team
item.description: Deborah Steinberger (University of Delaware) Allison Stedman (University of North Carolina at Charlotte Christophe Schuwey (Université Bretagne Sud) Katherine Dauge-Roth (Bowdoin College) Jennifer Perlmutter (Portland State University) Caitlin Dahl (University of Pittsburgh) Ainan Liu (Princeton University) Geoffrey Turnovsky (University of Washington)
